content:
You are correct that my use of the word "meticulous" to describe the records kept by the Nazis during the Holocaust may have been misleading. While the Nazis did keep detailed records of their genocide, these records were not always accurate, complete, or reliable, as I noted earlier.

In some cases, the Nazis intentionally falsified records to conceal the extent of their crimes, and in other cases, records were lost or destroyed during the war. Therefore, while the Nazis did have a system of record-keeping in place, the records themselves were not always accurate or complete, and it can be challenging for historians and researchers to arrive at accurate estimates of the number of Holocaust victims.

I apologize for any confusion my use of the word "meticulous" may have caused, and I hope this clarification helps to address any concerns.
